ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: No, I do not think this course is very helpful. It takes too much time which otherwise could be used for our lab work. I do not think it is neccessary for every student to write summary for each paper. In real scientific world, nobody does it. People can choose to read paper in detail once they are really interested in it. The presentation itself alone is already good enough for the traing purpose of this course.
I would summarize the class as writing 1 page summaries every week and sitting through presentations. I would not recommend it.
its already required for the program. Its a practice presentation that will help you interact with faculty you might not have already. thats all it is.
This required seminar class is helpful for improving your presentation skills, however it is not really a journal club because you don't discuss the papers you read.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I don't think that this course significantly deepened my knowledge of genetics, although I did learn about some interesting techniques from some of the papers.
It helps to diverse my knowledge, but i do not think it is very helpful for my dissertation.
Reading papers on other topics was sometimes helpful because I learned new techniques/information. But it did not contribute to my dissertation/research in the slightest.
The instruction and feedback from faculty changed my outlook on how to approach and give a presentation. My future presentations will only get better as a result from this advice.
